column2: G.V.R., 45-54 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Caregiver)
column9: My wife recently began using Enbrel for Psoriasis.  She has always been healthy until recently when she began to complain of a severe headache.  Within days she suffered a debilitating stroke and has a long recovery ahead of her.  After exhaustive testing the doctors could not find a cause for the blockage since there was no plaque anywhere within her cardiovascular system. The conclusion was that the lining of her carotid artery developed a tear which in turn formed a blot clot. According to the doctors this usually only occurs after some form of physical injury to the neck.  My wife had none.  I was surprised to learn recently that my wife associates her stroke with and believes it was caused by Enbrel since it was the only thing that had changed in her life.  I had doubts until I had a moment of free time to do some research on the internet.  Now I believe she may very well be right.  As one website described...  "Adverse events have been reported during post-approval use of Enbrel®. Because these events are reported voluntarily from a population of uncertain size, it is not always possible to reliably estimate their frequency or establish a causal relationship to Enbrel® exposure."Guess what was on the list along with many other disorders...     Strokes!!!   Please use caution when taking any new drugs.  Ask questions.  Report any changes in your body you notice.  Unfortunately this lesson was learned too late for us and doesn't help my wife but maybe it can help another.  One person's miracle drug may be another's poison!!!  Beware.   Be cautious.
